description: Spartan Protocol AMM had critical error in addLiquidity function. Instead of using minimum of base/token ratios for LP units (like Uniswap), it used the average. This allowed attackers to provide imbalanced liquidity and receive far more LP tokens than deserved.
attack_scenario: 1) Pool: 100 BASE, 100 TOKEN, 100 totalUnits. 2) Attacker adds 1 BASE + 99 TOKEN (heavily imbalanced). 3) baseRatio = 1*100/100 = 1, tokenRatio = 99*100/100 = 99. 4) BUG: liquidityUnits = (1+99)/2 = 50 (should be min(1,99) = 1!). 5) Attacker got 50 units for only 1 BASE worth of value. 6) Removes liquidity: gets 33 BASE + 33 TOKEN. 7) Net profit per cycle. 8) Repeated to drain $30M.
root_cause: addLiquidity used average of ratios instead of minimum. Formula: (baseRatio + tokenRatio) / 2 instead of min(baseRatio, tokenRatio). This broke the fundamental AMM invariant that LP tokens should represent proportional ownership.
